data.title: R.I. arts calendar, week of May 6
data.meta_description: SUNDAY \n  Crocodile River Music: West African music, Central Congregational Church Hall, 296 Angell St., Providence. 831-1800. Hamilton House Music Series; refreshments. 4-5:30 p.m. $15, seniors $12,…
data.text:
SUNDAY

Crocodile River Music: West African music, Central Congregational Church Hall, 296 Angell St., Providence. 831-1800. Hamilton House Music Series; refreshments. 4-5:30 p.m. $15, seniors $12, students $10, family $25.

"The Drag" with Kevin Broccoli: facebook.com/EpicTheatreCo. A five-night, 10 p.m. live talk show hosted by the Epic Theatre Company artistic director, from Theater 82 in Cranston, streamed on Facebook. With nightly guests. Sun: comedian Jay Are Adams and actor Kerry Giorgi. Mon: actor Samantha Gaus and theater critic Terry Shea. Tue: Nick Thibeault and Cardryell Truss. Wed: artistic directors Theodore Clement and Jonathan Pitts-Wiley. Thu: Betsy Rinaldi and Tim White.

Magnolia Cajun Band: Cajun, zydeco, Sandywoods Center for the Arts, 43 Muse Way, Tiverton. Sandywoodsmusic.com. 8 p.m. $15.

Michael McDonald: soul, rhythm and blues, pop, rock, Veterans Memorial Auditorium, 1 Avenue of the Arts, Providence. 421-2787, thevetsri.com. 7 p.m. $49.50-$69.50.

Music at the Meeting House Spring Concert: Chepachet Baptist Church, 1213 Putnam Pike, Glocester. chepachetbaptist.org. "Spring in Provence," features harpist Hyunjung Choi and flutist Susan Thomas of the Rhode Island Philharmonic. Works by Saint Saëns, Fauré, Bartok, Britten and others that includes serenades, folk dances and opera excerpts. Reception follows. 2:30 p.m. Offering will be taken.

Ricky King Russell All Stars: blues, rock, Chan’s Restaurant, 267 Main St., Woonsocket. 765-1900, chanseggrollsandjazz.com. 3-7 p.m. $20.

MONDAY

John Allmark Jazz Orchestra: The Met, Hope Artiste Village, 1005 Main St., Pawtucket. 729-1005, themetri.com. All ages. 9 p.m. $8.

Staged Readings, Trinity Rep Playwriting Competition: Trinity Repertory Company, 201 Washington St., Providence. Actors to read winning scripts in contest of New England high school students, by Kate Fitzgerald (Lincoln School), Jonathan Baron (LaSalle Academy), James Roberts (Putney School, Vermont) and Emma Paulhus (Dighton Rehoboth Regional, Massachusetts). 7 p.m. Free.

WEDNESDAY

Jackson Browne: rock, Providence Performing Arts Center, 220 Weybosset St. 421-2787, ppacri.org. 7:30 p.m. $49-$115.

RISD Film/Animation/Video Festival: Rhode Island School of Design Auditorium, 7 Canal Walk, Providence. Screening of work of 46 RISD seniors. 7 p.m. Free. Program A screens May 9 and May 11; Program B screens May 10 and May 12.

THURSDAY

The Bridget Bishop Tour: Comedy Connection, 39 Warren Ave., East Providence. 438-8383, ricomedyconnection.com. Duo of Krystyna Hutchinson and Corinne Fisher. Thu 8 p.m.; Fri 8, 10:30 p.m.; Sat 7:30, 10 p.m. $25.

"The Inside of His Severed Head": Daydream Theatre Company, RISE Playhouse, 142 Clinton St., Woonsocket. smarttix.com. New musical comedy by Lenny Schwartz tells the story of Willy Loman, an aging vampire hunter who realizes his life is empty, and tries to fill it in the last 24 hours of his life. Thu-Sat 8 p.m. $15.

"Menopause The Musical": Veterans Memorial Auditorium, 1 Avenue of the Arts, Providence. 421-2787, thevetsri.com. A celebration through comedy of women who are on the brink of, in the middle of, or have survived "The Change." 7:30 p.m. $38-$58.

"Ragtime": Little Theatre of Fall River, Bristol Community College, Jackson Arts Center, 777 Elsbree St., Fall River. (508) 675-1852, littletheatre.net. Musical based on the E.L. Doctorow tale of an upper-class white mother, a Jewish immigrant and an African American musician from Harlem pursuing the American Dream at the turn of the century. Opening Night pre-show entertainment (6 p.m.) features Portuguese folkloric singing and an exhibit by Fall River Historical Society. Thu-Sat. 7:30 p.m., Sun 2 p.m. $25, discounts for seniors and students.

Brian Regan: comedy, Providence Performing Arts Center, 220 Weybosset St., Providence. 421-2787, ppacri.org. 7:30 p.m. $35-$55.

FRIDAY

Blac Youngsta: hip-hop, rap, The Strand, 79 Washington St., Providence. 331-5876, thestrandri.com. 9 p.m. $30.

Jimmy "Two Suits" Capone & The Chan Clan All Stars: blues/rock, Chan’s Restaurant, 267 Main St., Woonsocket. 765-1900, chanseggrollsandjazz.com. $20 advance; $25 door. 8 p.m.

"The Mystery of Edwin Drood": The Players, Barker Playhouse, 400 Benefit St., Providence. 273-0590, playersri.org. The play-within-a-play is a whodunit musical based on the unfinished Charles Dickens novel. Fri-Sat 7:30 p.m., Sun 2 p.m. $25, students $15, members free.

Silverteeth, 123 Astronaut, Eric and The Nothing, Extraordinary Rendition Band: rock, Columbus Theatre, 270 Broadway, Providence. 621-9660, columbustheatre.com. 9 p.m. $10 advance; $12 day of.

"Trans Views": Westminster Unitarian Church, 119 Kenyon Ave., East Greenwich. web.uri.edu/prov/arts. Frank Toti Jr.'s play shares personal stories from oral histories that raise issues and bear witness to the challenges facing transgender women and men. Presented by URI Feinstein Providence Campus Arts and Culture Program with the R.I. State Council of Churches. Performance followed by a moderated discussion. 7 p.m. Free.

SATURDAY

August Alsina: rhythm and blues, Fête Ballroom, 103 Dike St., Providence. 383-1112, fetemusic.com. 8 p.m. $40-$155.

"Designing Women": Walking tour featuring women who have helped shape Rhode Island history, including RISD cofounder Helen Adelia Rowe Metcalf, entrepreneur and activist Christiana Carteaux Bannister, and poet and spiritualist Sarah Helen Whitman. Leaves at 11 a.m. from John Brown House Museum, 52 Power St., Providence. $15, $12 Rhode Island Historical Society members. For tickets, go to shop-rihs.com/item/designing-women-walking-tour, call 331-8575, ext. 360, or email jwilson@rihs.org.

Donna the Buffalo: Narrows Center for the Arts, 16 Anawan St., Fall River. (508) 324-1926, narrowscenter.org. 8 p.m. $27 advance; $30 day of.

Island Moving Co.: Veterans Memorial Auditorium, 1 Avenue of the Arts, Providence. 421-2787, thevetsri.com. Performances include premiere of new contemporary ballet by Maurice Causey, with music by the Rhode Island Civic Chorale and Orchestra. 7:30 p.m. $60, $75.

Luther "Guitar Jr." Johnson & The Magic Rockers: blues/rock, Chan’s Restaurant, 267 Main St., Woonsocket. 765-1900, chanseggrollsandjazz.com. $20 advance; $25 door. 8 p.m.

KC Moaners, Martin Grosswendt and Susanne Salem-Schatz: Americana, folk, Stone Church Coffee House, First Congregational Church, 300 High St., Bristol. 253-4813. 7:30 p.m. $18.

Anselmo Ralph: rhythm and blues, kizomba, The Strand, 79 Washington St., Providence. 331-5876, thestrandri.com. 9 p.m. $40.

William Shatner and "Wrath of Khan": Providence Performing Arts Center, 220 Weybosset St., Providence. 421-2787, ppacri.org. Live on stage for conversation and Q&A after a screening of "Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan." 7:30 p.m. $29.50-$150.

Sine Nomine Choral Ensemble: Rehoboth Congregational Church, 139 Bay State Rd., Rehoboth. sinenominechoir.org. "From Shapenote to Lauridsen, An American Pastiche." Works by Thompson, Lauridsen, Copland, Providence's Will Ayton. 7:30 p.m. $20, seniors/students $15.

Rick Springfield: rock, Twin River Casino Event Center, 100 Twin River Rd., Lincoln. twinriver.com. 8 p.m. $55, $65.

— Journal Staff
